message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about sentence simplification, which is a natural language processing task. The paper proposes a novel model based on a multi-layer and multi-head attention architecture, which is a common technique used in deep learning models for natural language processing. The paper also integrates an external paraphrase knowledge base for simplification, which is a common technique used in machine translation and paraphrase generation. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to natural language processing. Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which are all related to the techniques used in the paper.
